short_description: Creates sessions for a clickstream data.
long_description: The Sessionize function maps each click in a session to a unique session identifier. A session is defined as a sequence of clicks by one user that are separated by at most The function is useful both for sessionization and for detecting web crawler (bot) activity. It is typically used to understand user browsing behavior on a web site. Sessionize is a SQL function. Sample code is included with the Teradata SQLMapReduce Java API.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input table
input_tables.description: Specifies the name of the input table

argument_clauses.name: TimeColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the name of the input column that contains the click times. Note: The timestamp_column must also be an order_column.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the name of the input column that contains the click times. Note: The timestamp_column must also be an order_column .

argument_clauses.name: TimeOut
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the number of seconds at which the session times out. If session_timeout seconds elapse after a click, then the next click starts a new session. The data type of session_timeout is DOUBLE PRECISION.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the number of seconds at which the session times out. If session_timeout seconds elapse after a click, the next click starts a new session. The data type of session_timeout is DOUBLE PRECISION.

argument_clauses.name: ClickLag
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the minimum number of seconds between clicks for the session user to be considered human. If clicks are more frequent, indicating that the user is a “bot,” the function ignores the session. The min_human_click_lag must be less than session_timout. The data type of min_human_click_lag is DOUBLE PRECISION.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the minimum number of seconds between clicks for the session user to be considered human. If clicks are more frequent, indicating that the user is a bot, the function ignores the session. The min_human_click_lag must be less than session_timout . The data type of min_human_click_lag is DOUBLE PRECISION. Default behavior: The function ignores no session, regardless of click frequency.

argument_clauses.name: EmitNull
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies whether to output rows that have NULL values in their session id and rapid fire columns, even if their timestamp_column has a NULL value. The default value is 'false'.
argument_clauses.description: Specify whether to output rows that have NULL values in their session id and rapid fire columns, even if their timestamp_column has a NULL value. Default: 'false'

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
